trial_identification.studytitle: Acute & Short Term effects of specialty mix herb & spice capsules on blood pressure in humans
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Acute & short term effects of specialty mix herb & spice capsules on blood pressure in normotensive and hypertensive humans

interventions.interventions:
Culinary Herb and Spice Mixture (Capsule A)
Each capsule contains: 150mg cinnamon, 150 mg clove, 150 mg amla, 150 mg oregano
Dose: 3 capsules per day
Duration: 14 days
Administration: Capsules are taken orally
interventions.comparator:
Culinary Herb and Spice Mixture (Capsule B)
Each capsule contains: 150 mg turmeric, 150 mg ginger, 10 mg black pepper, 150 mg chilli
Dose: 3 capsules per day
Duration: 14 days
Administration: Capsules are taken orally

primaryOutcome.outcome: 24 hour Ambulatory blood pressure change from baseline to day 14.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: 24 hour Ambulatory blood pressure change from baseline measurement to 24 hours post initial supplementation.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: 24 hours following the initial capsule consumption.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria:
Age between 18 and 70 years
Weight stable (not lost/gained >4kg in the past month) Normotensive with Blood pressure at or below 120/80 mmHg Pre-hypertensive with BP >120/80 but less than 140/90 mmHg Hypertensive with BP >140/90 but less than 160/100 mmHg
eligibility.exclusivecriteria:
Anyone on medication for hypertension
Anyone with severe, or stage 2, hypertension which is classified as blood pressure above 160/100mg
Anyone who is pregnant, or intending to become pregnant during the study period

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This study aims to see whether common herbs and spices have the ability to lower high blood pressure.
